snippet: David Zinman, on loan from the Tonhalle Orchestra of Zurich, conducts the New York Philharmonic in the Modern Beethoven festival.
abstract: Allan Kozinn reviews concert of musical works by Beethoven and Stravinsky performed by the New York Philharmonic, featuring guest conductor David Zinman, at Avery Fisher Hall as part of the Modern Beethoven festival.
lead_paragraph: David Zinman, on loan from the Tonhalle Orchestra of Zurich, conducts the New York Philharmonic in the Modern Beethoven festival.

headline.seo: New York Philharmonic in the Modern Beethoven Festival
headline.main: What Do Beethoven and Stravinsky Have in Common? Listen Closely
headline.print_headline: What Do Beethoven and Stravinsky Have in Common? Listen Closely
